item.title: Deb add a quote by Laura Wiess
item.description: "We mutinied quietly, using every lesson we’d been taught by every person who’d ever used us for their own benefit." -- Laura Wiess

item.title: Deb add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Deb add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Deb add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "...there would be punishment and pain, and there would be happiness, too. That was writing." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweller's felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn't exist, and I have tried everything that does." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I'm so afraid of losing something I love that I refuse to love anything" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Why are you leaving me? He wrote, I do not know how to live. I do not know either but I am trying. I do not know how to try. There were some things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So i buried them and let them hurt me" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It's the tragedy of loving, you can't love anything more than something you miss." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Many people need desperately to receive this message: 'I feel and think much as you do, care about many of the things you care about, although most people do not care about them. You are not alone." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All these people talk so eloquently about getting back to good old-fashioned values. Well, as an old poop I can remember back to when we had those old-fashioned values, and I say let's get back to the good old-fashioned First Amendment of the good old-fashioned Constitution of the United States -- and to hell with the censors! Give me knowledge or give me death!" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We could have saved [the Earth] but we were too damned cheap." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I am eternally grateful for my knack of finding in great books, some of them very funny books, reason enough to feel honored to be alive, no matter what else might be going on." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I wanted all things To seem to make some sense, So we could all be happy, yes, Instead of tense. And I made up lies So that they all fit nice, And I made this sad world A par-a-dise." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "He was talking about the sign that said 'THE COMPLICATED FUTILITY OF IGNORANCE.' 'All knew was that I didn't want my daughter or anybody's child to see a message that negative every time she comes into the library,' he said. 'And then I found out it was you who was responsible for it.' 'What's so negative about it?' I said. 'What could be a more negative word than "futility"?' he said. '"Ignorance,"' I said." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When the last living thing Has died on account of us, How poetical it would be If Earth could say, In a voice floating up Perhaps From the floor Of the Grand Canyon, "It is done." People did not like it here." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Just because you can read, write and do a little math, doesn't mean that you're entitled to conquer the universe." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I now believe that the only way in which Americans can rise above their ordinariness, can mature sufficiently to rescue themselves and to help rescue their planet, is through enthusiastic intimacy with works of their own imagination." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "There is no WHY, since the moment simply is, and since all of us are simply trapped in the moment, like bugs in Amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut
